metadata.title: CVE-2018-12121 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Node.js: All versions prior to Node.js 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0:Denial of Service with large HTTP headers: By using a combination of manyrequests with maximum sized headers (almost 80 KB per connection), andcarefully timed completion of the headers, it is possible to cause the HTTPserver to abort from heap allocation failure. Attack potential is mitigatedby the use of a load balancer or other proxy layer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode64 - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
nodejs - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.15.1~dfsg-5').
